summary: This document is an email chain from June 12, 2020, regarding a journalist's request to fact-check claims about the FBI's involvement in the Jeffrey Epstein case for a podcast called 'Broken: Jeffrey Epstein'. The emails are forwarded within the FBI's New York office to coordinate a response from the Public Affairs office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of podcast and federal case
persons.context: The central subject of the podcast 'Broken: Jeffrey Epstein' and the associated federal case that is being fact-checked.

events.title: Fact-Check Request for Epstein Podcast
events.description: A journalist sends a request to the FBI's National Press Office to fact-check claims about the FBI's involvement in the federal case against Jeffrey Epstein for a podcast.

keyFacts: A journalist was fact-checking a podcast titled 'Broken: Jeffrey Epstein' in June 2020.
The podcast episode explored the federal case against Jeffrey Epstein and made several mentions of the FBI's involvement.
The request for fact-checking was forwarded within the FBI's New York office to the Public Affairs office for coordination.
The document shows ongoing media and public interest in the FBI's role in the Epstein case years after the initial investigations.
